thread.title: 'La La Land' wins best picture, director at Academy Awards - Washington Times
thread.title_full: 'La La Land' wins best picture, director at Academy Awards - Washington Times

author: The Washington Times Http
title: 'La La Land' wins best picture, director at Academy Awards - Washington Times
text:
More... This image released by Lionsgate shows Ryan Gosling, right, and Emma Stone in a scene from, “La La Land.” The film is nominated for an Oscar for best picture. The 89th Academy Awards will take place on Feb. 26. (Dale ... more > View Comments Print By Eric Althoff - The Washington Times - Updated: 12:07 a.m. on Monday, February 27, 2017 
LOS ANGELES —“La La Land” was crowned the king of Hollywood Sunday night, taking home the best picture award, as well as those for cinematography, best actress, best director, best song and best score. 
The musical fantasy love letter to Tinseltown was made for $30 million and has grossed nearly $200 million. 
The film stars Emma Stone and Ryan Gosling in a meet-cute story about young artists in Hollywood that harks back to the golden age of musicals. Director Damian Chazelle became the youngest best director in history at the age of 32. 
Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway, who co-starred in “Bonnie and Clyde” a half-century ago, were tapped to hand out the biggest award of the evening.
